+qwerty222999 When you buy a rapier, its bound to you, much like any other 
item. When you die, you drop it, and when it's picked up by an ally, it's 
still your rapier, and it's muted. However, if an enemy picks it up, it's 
converted into a free rapier, making it free to use for anyone.

comments.text:
+Alex ApoZz If you buy a rapier, it's bound to you, so it's muted when 
anyone else holds it. When you drop it, it remains muted for others, until 
an enemy hero picks it up. At that moment, the game changes the rapier 
permanently into an unbound state in which anyone who holds it can use it. 
Eg. if you die and lose the rapier that you just bought, and a teammate 
picks it up, your teammate doesn't get the bonus damage and can drop it or 
hand it back to you. In the free, unbound state, you cannot drop it or give 
it away.

comments.author: Эдуард Вятчанин

comments.text:
Rigwarl has relatively low HP for a Strength hero which forces him to rely 
on items(if I'm not mistaken his only stated items were Power Treads, a 
Magic Stick, a Vanguard, and a Town Portal Scroll) and his passive 
Bristleback, which is useless if the damage source is in front of him(as 
was the case here). You also have to bear in mind that Nyx Assassin hit 
him with a combo that would deal at least 1,210 points of damage(assuming 
he's level 16 and hasn't upgraded his Dagon), and he definitely lost a good 
chunk of health beforehand due to Spectre having a Radiance, using Haunt, 
and taking damage that would trigger her Dispersion ability.

All in all, it seems pretty legit to me.
comments.author: Brutalyte616

comments.author: James Harding

comments.text: +dragonslair951167 well... im glad you enjoyed doing it! Good math btw
comments.author: Lusydia Knight

comments.text:
Here's the math: Bristleback has 1195 base health at level 16 (probably no 
lower, considering the ease with which they killed Roshan is an indication 
that the game's been going on a good while), which is increased to 1654 
from items (1195 + 57 from magic wand + 152 from power treads + 250 from 
vanguard).

Nyx Assassin is presumably running the standard Nyx build with Urn, Dagon 
and Arcane Boots. Bristleback's armor and vanguard would block a lot of 
autoattack damage, so I will ignore the base damage from his Vendetta 
autoattack. The Vendetta bonus damage is reduced by 30% from Bristleback's 
armor, leaving it at 367 damage. The impale and dagon blast do 1060 base 
damage together, but taking into account Bristleback's pipe and base magic 
resistance, it would do 530 (1060 * 3/4 * 2/3) damage, for a grand total of 
897 damage.

So, unless Spectre managed to do almost as much burst damage as Nyx 
Assassin with just her Haunt and Radiance (most likely in BB's back or 
side, I might add), Nyx Assassin wouldn't even come close to killing 
Bristleback and would die like the rest of his team. And I know this is an 
animated series, but it's a poor entertainer that can't take criticism and 
I liked doing the math.

EDIT: I forgot to take into account Rubick's Null Field, which gives BB 
another 20% magic damage reduction. That brings the magic damage down to 
424 (530 * 4/5) and brings the grand total amount of damage down to 791- 
less than half his health. And to those who say we don't know what happened 
off screen that would bring BB's health down, we also don't know if things 
happened off screen that would bring it back up either. Rubick's Mekansm or 
Fade Bolt, the Pipe's active ability, and the regen auras from both items 
are not calculated here.
comments.author: dragonslair951167

captions.text: NIGEL: Gyro, your Divine Rapier.

GYRO: I thought this would take four to six business
days to get here.
Yahoo!
ENIGMA: So, are we just pushing middle? All or nothing?
RUBICK: Sounds like a plan to me.
BB: Let's put all of our quills on the table.
INVOKER: Are you serious, we'll throw the game!

GYRO: One cannot throw that which has not been caught
in the first place.
ENIGMA: What?

RUBICK: Remember, if the holder of the Rapier dies,
it is dropped and anyone can pick it up!
ENIGMA: Man, I can't see anything up there.
It's so... foggy.
RUBICK: Let's wait on some of our creeps.
ENIGMA: What? How is that going to help anything-oh!
Alright, when I activate my Black King Bar,

that's when you know that I'm going to blink
in!
Okay... okay...
Wait for it... wait for it...
No! Ow! No! Blink Dagger activate, come on!
Ow.
RUBICK: Time for Rubick to haunt YOU!
GYRO: Bring it on! It's time for Divine!
Why does that even work?
I'm in a flying machine!
Aaoow!
ENIGMA: It would've never worked between us, darling.
You... killed me.
And you're on Pudge's team.
INVOKER: Power beyond imagining!
No! Ack!
Ha ha!
RUBICK: Oh no!
NP: Well...
Played.
BB: I've made your wood limp. Ha ha!
Bad idea, mate.
Well then, is there anyone left?
RUBICK: May the best magus win!
Uh oh...
NP: Game is hard.
GLaDOS: Your middle barracks has been destroyed.
Your enemy has spawned Mega Creeps.
ENIGMA: What?
After all that we just... lose?
We can't lose!
RUBICK: Sure we can, that's Dota.
NIGEL: Can't win them all, can you?
Losing is just a part of Dota it seems.

But the important thing is that you can take
away something

from the experience, and apply it to your
next game.
RUBICK: Apply yourself!

NIGEL: Gyrocopter, I'm sure you learned something
and can do better next time.
Maybe a different item setup would've helped?
GYRO: Yeah, a Black King Bar would've been awesome!
And Rubick, you have great leadership.
But maybe work on some basics like more wards
or better usage of your items like Mekansm?

RUBICK: You're right! Next time the Grand Magus will
be much grander!

Invoker, you learned about your spells and
I'm sure you got more comfortable with them,
but maybe cooperate with your teammates more?

INVOKER: But my four teammates were the only reason
I lost this game.

Oh, I should probably make sure the Dire team
knows that...
I think I'd feel much better about myself.
Attention Dire Heroes!
The reason I lost was my teammates.
All of the blame should be placed upon them.
Well then, off to go hide somewhere.
Don't want my stats to look any worse!
NIGEL: And Bristleback, you were kind of... there.
BB: Yeah...
NIGEL: Enigma, you could improve on team cooperation,

communication, using your items at opportune
times, map awareness, pushing lanes...
ENIGMA: Okay! Okay. Okay.
NIGEL: But that's what I've taken away from this.

Dota is tough, but each game can be a learning
experience and be fun.
ENIGMA: Yeah, we'll get them next time!
Good game.
ALL: GG.
ENIGMA: Would you f***ing end the f***ing game
instead of camping our fountain you f*** **** **************!

title: The DOTA 2 Reporter Episode 40: Divine Intervention (Season Finale)
